reference.title: Different Markup Languages
reference.shortdesc: Following is a list of some of the most popular markup languages.

ul.li: HTML – Hypertext Markup Language, defined as a part of implementing World Wide Web
KML – Keyhole Markup Language, XML-based markup language used for exchanging geographic information
XHTML – extensible Hypertext Markup Language, HTML reformulated in XML syntax
XML – extensible Markup Language, defines a set of rules for encoding documents in both human-readable and machine-readable format
Markdown – plaintext markup popular as language of blog/cms posts and comments
LaTEX – a format for describing complex type and page layout often used for mathematics, technical, and academic publications
Wiki Markup – used in Wikipedia, MediaWiki and other Wiki installations
